At Tue, 15 Feb 2011 09:50:28 -0000,
virginie wrote:
>
> Hi All,
> When I unpack the Whole WARC-File I have as result something like that:
> http://www.example.com/001file.txt
> http://www.example.com/002file.txt
> http://www.example.com/003file.txt
> http://www.example.com/004file.txt
> http://www.example.com/005file.txt
> http://www.example.com/006file.txt
> http://www.example.com/007file.txt
> http://www.example.com/008file.txt
> But I would like to have the content from each url (http://www.example.com/001file.txt).
> how can I obtain the content from 001file.txt,002file.txt etc...
> please can you help me?

Hi Virginie,

I am not sure that I understand your question.

I would like to strongly encourage you *not* to continue unpacking
WARC files in this way. There are many reasons for this:

a) Unpacking WARC files causes a loss of information (e.g. HTTP
   requests, HTTP response headers, WARC metadata, etc.) WARC files
   are not simply a collection of files, but contain detailed
   information about a web crawl.
b) URIs do not map cleanly to file names, so you will be constantly
   trying to work around this issue.
c) WARC is an ISO standard, so storing WARC files should be a pretty easy
   sell to your organization.

That said, could you explain the question a bit more?

best, Erik Hetzner

--Multipart_Tue_Feb_15_11:08:07_2011-1
